entry.title: Does S/4HANA Cloud Private edition support Indonesian language?
entry.content:
Seek expert guidance if S/4HANA Cloud Private edition supports Indonesian language.

Indonesian is listed in https://help.sap.com/doc/392c858a3cc8489d993d1abc060b642c/Cloud/en-US/SAP_Translation_Hub_EN.pdf 

https://dam.sap.com/mac/app/p/pdf/asset/preview/68S9i3C?h=&ltr=a

show that the solution comes with best practices for 64 country/region versions in 39 languages and incorporates best-in-class processes across 25 industries. Checked with AI, got the supported language list as below.

  1. Arabic
  2. Bulgarian
  3. Chinese (Simplified)
  4. Chinese (Traditional)
  5. Croatian
  6. Czech
  7. Danish
  8. Dutch
  9. English
  10. Estonian
  11. Finnish
  12. French
  13. German
  14. Greek
  15. Hebrew
  16. Hungarian
  17. Italian
  18. Japanese
  19. Korean

  29. Serbian (Latin)

  39. Vietnamese

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About the SAP Young Professionals Program
entry.content:
If you’re an ambitious graduate looking to launch your tech consulting career, the SAP Young Professionals program might be the opportunity you’ve been waiting for! This free, immersive training experience opens doors to become an SAP Associate Consultant and kick-start your career among SAP's. 

What is the SAP Young Professionals program?

It is a free, 2-3 month intensive training initiative from the SAP Digital Skills Center that aims to equip recent university graduates (with less than 3 years of graduation) with SAP knowledge, soft skills, and certifications that prepare them for SAP consulting-related position within the EMEA region. 

Graduates are trained in SAP technologies such as: SAP S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Artificial Intelligence, SAP Business Technology Platform, within others ((Modules may vary by cohort or region).

Who is eligible for the program?

Applicants typically need to meet the following criteria.

  • Hold a university degree (Bachelor’s or higher). 
  • Be a recent graduate (within the past 3 years).
  • Be currently unemployed or underemployed
  • Show strong English proficiency.
  • Be citizens or legal residents of the country where the program is being offered.

Note: Specific requirements may vary depending on country and region.

What does the program include?

Over the course of 2–3 months, participants will:

  • Earn globally recognized certifications 
  • Gain access to SAP Learning Hub and be trained by SAP specialists 
  • Develop soft skills
  • Have the possibility of starting your career as Associate Consultant in SAP's ecosystem (partners + customers)

Is the program really free?

Yes. The SAP Digital Skills Center delivers this program at no cost to participants as part of SAP’s mission to close the digital skills gap and support sustainable employment. SAP invests in rising talent to help drive digital transformation across industries.

Is employment guaranteed after completing the program?

While job placement is not guaranteed, one of the key goals of YPP is to connect graduates with SAP partners and customers who are actively hiring. Many graduates secure employment within the SAP ecosystem shortly after completing the program. However, success depends on the graduate's performance, certification results, and engagement throughout the course.

How to apply?

Applications are submitted via 👉 SAP Digital Skills Center portal.

Keep an eye on the website or SAP’s social media channels for announcements about new program cohorts in your region.

entry.title: Unallocated value displayed in migrated S/4 data does not match pre-migration data – Material Ledger
entry.content:
We are currently undergoing a Brownfield migration to S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023 [02 (10/2024)].

After the migration of our quality environment, completed in June 2025, we identified that all materials consumed at standard cost and generating price differences started to show unassigned values in the periods related to the migrated data. In the production environment, these price differences for the same periods were correctly rolled up to the next level. These unassigned values do not match the expected behavior for our current scenario.

The analyses were carried out using transaction CKM3, and the unassigned values shown are significantly high, distorting reports and directly impacting the managerial view that will be used by the business.

Based on SAP Notes related to Material Ledger in S/4HANA, we understand that there is no longer a distinction between single-level and multilevel price differences. However, we believe the migrated data should faithfully reflect what was previously processed in the productive system — that is, the same total values across the relevant categories (opening/closing inventory, receipts, consumption).

When accessing CKM3 for periods that include migrated data, the reports display abnormal and inflated values, leading to an internal question:
Shouldn’t this data be viewed using transaction CKM3OLD instead?

However, upon reviewing SAP Note 2426371, we found the following guidance:

"For the unmigrated data, you need to use the transaction CKM3OLD. The unmigrated data are the data that are older than last period of year before previous year. For migrated data, in CKM3 or CKM3N you can show only the summarization data and without the individual posting lines and without material ledger settlement line. To show the whole posting, you need to use the transaction CKM3OLD. You may need to use both of the transaction CKM3 and CKM3OLD if you have mixed data in the same period created before and after the upgrade to S/HANA."

In other words, since the migration took place in June 2025, data from December 2023 onwards is considered migrated and should be analyzed using CKM3/CKM3N, even if in summarized form.
Data prior to December 2023 should be analyzed via CKM3OLD.

However, the main issue is not the summarization of the data, but rather the fact that the values presented in the migrated data do not reflect the same reality seen in the productive environment prior to the migration, especially in detail.

We also have custom developments (Z programs) that call standard CKM3 functions in mass processing, and they are also heavily impacted — returning the same distorted view regarding the unassigned amounts.

I am attaching visual evidence that clearly demonstrates the discrepancies we have observed.

We need to understand whether this is an expected behavior after migration (something we have to live with), or if it may indicate an issue in the migration steps — so we can raise this clearly with our business partner and properly explain the reason behind the current results.

Thank you!

entry.title: SQL Query – Report for Approval Status and Approval Tracking
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

We are currently working on a custom report to track the approval status and approval history of documents (such as Purchase Requisitions, Purchase Orders) in our SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023 system.

Kindly assist us with the SQL query or relevant CDS views/tables required to extract the following information:

  • Document number and type

  • Requested by (user)

  • Approval status (e.g., Approved, Pending, Rejected)

  • Approver name(s)

  • Approval date(s)

  • Any remarks or comments

  • Multi-level approval tracking if applicable

Please share the list of tables or views used in S/4HANA for such tracking, especially for standard approval workflows (e.g., via Flexible Workflow, BWFLOW, etc.).

Looking forward to your guidance or sample query to help us generate this report.

Best regards,

silambarasan

entry.title: Sharing PO Responsibilities Between Two Company Codes (GR & Cost Split)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm exploring a business requirement involving two company codes and would appreciate your insights:

  • Company Code 1 creates a Purchase Order to a supplier.

  • Company Code 2 receives the goods (Goods Receipt) against that PO.

  • Company Code 1 is responsible for paying the material cost.

  • Company Code 2 is responsible for paying the customs/duties related to the import.

My current approach:

  • Company Code 1 issues the PO to the supplier,

  • Then an Intercompany STO is created from Company Code 1 to Company Code 2 (Free of Charge),

  • Company Code 2 receives the goods via the STO.

However, this adds complexity and time to the process.

Question:
Is there any alternative or simplified solution in SAP S/4HANA that allows:

  • Company Code 1 to issue the PO,

  • Company Code 2 to post the Goods Receipt directly against that PO,

  • And each company code to handle their respective costs (material vs. customs)?

We would appreciate any advice on configurations, custom enhancements, or standard processes that might help here.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Unify ECC and NetWeaver HCM during the S/4HANA conversion
entry.content:
Hello SAP Gurus,

I’m performing a brownfield conversion from ECC to S/4HANA, but the client also has a separate SAP HCM Standalone System with HCM, and they want to unify it into S/4HANA. How would this technical unification from ECC and NetWeaver HCM to S/4HANA be carried out?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: FUE Consumption Monitoring
entry.content:
Hi All,
 
One of our customers is requesting us to monitor their FUE consumption. We are not able to see this data in the SAP4Me portal for this particular customer. We have implemented Note 3333812. Even then, the FUE consumption details were not showing up in SAP4Me, for which they have mentioned that the metering results are available in SAP for me only if the systems are hosted by SAP. Since the systems of our customers are hosted by a Premium supplier, this metering data is not available with SAP, and we will have to reach out to your Premium supplier.
 
What is the best way to propose a solution to our customer here? Do the premium suppliers provide an option to allow the consumption monitoring? Any suggestions are welcome on this topic.
 
Regards
Lakshmi

entry.title: Unclassified User Type
entry.content:
Hi All

Please find that when we run the program "SLIM%DEV%CLF%HELP" report to check the User classifications, the report output shows "Not Classified" category of User types, along with the core, advanced and self-service types. How can we measure the FUE for the "Not classified" category?

Any suggestions on the same are welcome!

Regards

Lakshmi

entry.title: EWM-TM Integration: Clean Core alternative to unreleased BAdI in S/4HANA PCE
entry.content:
Hey community,

I'm implementing EWM with TM in S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition and hitting a Clean Core compliance issue.

Scenario: When TM is active in the system and I try to process goods issue in EWM (transaction /SCWM/PRDO), I get this error:

/SCWM/LK202 – TU for delivery assignment &1 / &2 not found

This happens because when TM is configured, the system automatically sets TRANSPL_TYPE = 'C' (when TMS_PLAN_IND = 'X'), which means EWM expects a Transportation Unit before allowing the goods issue. This blocks the entire outbound process.

Standard solution (blocked in PCE)
Note 3084918 addresses this - implement BAdI /SCWM/EX_ERP_MAPIN_OD_SAVEREPL and in method MAPIN, clear the field TRANSPL_TYPE in structure MT_DLV_REQUEST-s_head-t_transport.

The logic is simple and it works perfectly in on-premise systems. But here's the problem: in S/4HANA PCE with ABAP Cloud, the ATC check fails:

Error: Usage of not released application API: /SCWM/IF_EX_MAPIN_OD_SAVEREPL
Code: CHKC_IFACE_NOT_RELEASED

Can't transport this to production as it violates Clean Core principles.

What I've Tried
Looked for alternative BAdIs that might have access to TRANSPL_TYPE - no luck
Checked if there's any customizing to prevent the default 'C' value - nothing found
Searched for released APIs in the same process - all the relevant ones are unreleased
Tried to find workarounds in /SCWM/TU (called internally by /SCWM/PRDO) - same restrictions

Questions for the Community
Is there a released BAdI or API that allows modifying TRANSPL_TYPE in this EWM-TM scenario?
Any configuration trick to prevent the system from defaulting to transport type 'C' when TM is active?
Has anyone solved this in a Clean Core compliant way? Maybe a different approach I'm not seeing?
Does SAP have plans to release this BAdI for cloud environments? It seems like a standard requirement for EWM-TM integration.
This is becoming a blocker for the go-live. The functionality works great with the BAdI, but I need a solution that passes ATC checks.

Will definitely post the solution here once I find it. Thanks in advance!

Technical Details:

S/4HANA PCE 2023
Transaction: /SCWM/PRDO (Outbound Delivery Order)
Error occurs during goods issue processing
ABAP Cloud with strict ATC enforcement

entry.title: Tracking and Managing Reusable Packaging Materials in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
We are a polyurethane chemical manufacturing business with manufacturing and distribution entities.
Our finished goods and raw materials are packed in either drums or IBCs, or within more than 10 types of packages, which can be new, reused, or renewed.

We need to track package materials inventory, both empty and filled, and capture packaging costs accurately.
We also need detailed inventory visibility for empty packages that are possible to be used.

We are discovering the Handling Unit module but it seems to have many manual steps and difficult to implement.

Has anyone with similar operations solved this in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and how did you approach it?

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

entry.title: Manage Workflow for Supplier Invoice – Authorization & Decision Options Issue
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am using SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023. While configuring Manage Workflow for Supplier Invoice, we created simple rules and it worked fine. We did SPRO configuration  activated flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices (please refer to the attached screenshots for reference).

We noticed the following behavior:

  • If I check the Authorization option, the workflow does not trigger.

  • If I uncheck the Authorization option, the workflow triggers but in release/approve option not avail.

In the authorizer’s decision-making screen, the user is unable to see the expected Release/Approve or Reject options.
Instead, it shows Open Task, and under that, only Post or Delete actions are available (screenshot attached).

is this the standard behavior in S4 private cloud for supplier invoice workflow.

please guide me if any configuration changes are needed to get the proper.

 

 

thanks & regards,

silambarasan R

entry.title: Failed to create a source system based on SAP S/4HANA 2023 in SAP BW 7.5 SPS15
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I encountered an issue when trying to create a source system based on SAP S/4HANA 2023 in SAP BW 7.5 SPS15.

It appears to be a connection configuration problem.
The background user password for the RFC Destination (DEVCLNT110 for SAP S/4HANA 2023 Private Cloud Edition) in BW becomes invalid after configuration.

BW System message in RFC Destination for S/4HANA:

User password invalid for identifier /RFC/DEVCLNT110 (see long text)


Diagnosis:
Changes to the global key or system data have invalidated the passwords in secure storage.

 

ABAP Short Dump in ST22:

Category: External Error

Runtime Errors: CALL_FUNCTION_REMOTE_ERROR

Short Text: "Name or password is incorrect (repeat logon)"

Has anyone encountered a similar problem?
Any guidance or solutions would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Manage Purchase Order App – Header Level Condition Type Not Available for Landed Cost Elements
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are working on SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023 and using the Fiori native app “Manage Purchase Orders”.

Issue observed:

  • In the app, we are not able to see or select header-level condition types.
  • Specifically, we require these condition types to capture landed cost elements (e.g., freight, insurance, customs duties).
  • In the classic GUI transactions (ME21N/ME22N), header conditions are available. However, in the Fiori app they do not appear.

Questions:

  1. Is this functionality supported in the Manage Purchase Orders app?
  2. If not available, is there any roadmap item or SAP Note that enables header-level conditions in this Fiori app?
  3. What is the recommended best practice for handling landed cost conditions if we want to work fully in Fiori without reverting to “Advanced” (GUI-based) apps?

Any guidance or references would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Jeeva

entry.title: Hello SAP Community,We recently completed an upgrade from SAP S/4HANA 2021 to SAP S/4HANA 2023
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We recently completed an upgrade from SAP S/4HANA 2021 to SAP S/4HANA 2023 (Private Cloud Edition). After raising a service request regarding post-upgrade checks, SAP responded by referring us to SAP Note 2907976 – Silent Data Migration (SDMI).

I would like to understand:

  • What exactly does this note cover?
  • Is it mandatory to take any action based on this note after the upgrade?
  • How critical is SDMI in the context of system stability or data consistency?
  • Are there any recommended steps or best practices to follow related to SDMI after an upgrade?

Any insights or experiences from others who have gone through a similar upgrade would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Project Systems error on 'Aggregation Levels invalid'
entry.content:
Hi there,

I have an issue while posting from legacy system to S4 Hana (Private Cloud), where I am testing the functionality of below APIs:

  1. API_API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV/PlanData 
    Using limited fields (in payload) or complete set of fields (payload) results in this error: 
    'Resource not found for the segment 'PlanData'." Refers to SAP Note: 1797736 
     
  2. API_API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV/FinancialPlanData
    Same as above, but throws additional errors as system gets into additional validation for those fields that we don't input any values, and  we leave it with basic 'string' only.
     
  3. I realize we need to use the full payload, with a view to accommodate more fields in future.
  4. Question is: is it safe to use partial 'values based' fields only as in (1) above? 
  5. In any case, I get into 'Aggregation levels invalid' error. Not sure what I am missing? Can someone guide me, please? 

Any clue shall be helpful. 

Regards Siva
